I think you misunderstand.

First, for context, please view this forum post. http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/187-An-Update-on-the-Team

Time writing up a blog entry, or staying focused on the game?

On the surface this is a valid concern. But just how far does this line of reasoning extend? Should Harvester no longer make his usual blog entries? Should the developers and SQUAD staff avoid the forums at all costs? And how about those developer videos/interviews? That's got to be a huge waste of time right there.

No, the fact of the matter is, part of the reason KSP has such a dedicated following isn't just because it's an incredible game. It's because the developer isn't some faceless EA clone. They've historically not been afraid to communicate with their customers and fans, to reveal future features, to answer community questions (within reason), etc. They've even hired modders from the community to be part of the development staff. That's special right there. That's not something any ordinary developer is going to do. Unfortunately, you seem to want them to retreat into an impenetrable shell. To become a cloistered order, a faceless developer slamming out code from the confines of a small windowless box. But to have that happen would be a huge loss not just to the community, but arguably to SQUAD itself.

All this does is create false information and post going off track, much like this one has, over information that is not needed in the post to begin with.

And that's why it's not a bad idea to have a brief blog post like the one I linked to, just having the developers say hello and introducing new members of the team to the community. So they can generate even more positive PR while shutting down any rumors and/or false information.

Please realize, I'm not talking about personal, or even necessarily employment details here. I don't think anyone cares when Harvester showers, or what the pressure in his car's front passenger tire is. Just a very brief meet and greet like in the previous blog post.

Finally, this isn't a "demand" on my part, and I have no authority to "demand" anything of SQUAD anyway, even if I wanted to. People seem to be getting that confused. It's a "would be nice". Especially since they've shown a willingness to communicate with us on that level in the past.
